Introduction

Source: vignettes/1_introduction.Rmd
1_introduction.Rmd

Overview

REvoBC is an R package to identifiy and analyse Amplicon Sequence Variants after performing an experiment through the EVoBC kit.

Installing REvoBC

The R version of REvoBC can be installed from Github. To do so, we need to install the R packages REvoBC depends on and the devtools package.

# install REvoBC dependencies
if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
    install.packages("BiocManager")
if (!require("dada2")) BiocManager::install("dada2")
if (!require("tidyverse")) install.packages("tidyverse")
if (!require("cli")) install.packages("cli")
if (!require("Biostrings")) BiocManager::install("Biostrings")
if (!require("benthos")) install.packages("benthos")
if (!require("lemon")) install.packages("lemon")
if (!require("scales")) install.packages("scales")
if (!require("muscle")) BiocManager::install("muscle")
if (!require("R4RNA")) BiocManager::install("R4RNA")
if (!require("ggmsa")) install.packages("ggmsa")
if (!require("utils")) install.packages("utils")
if (!require("methods")) install.packages("methods")
if (!require("data.table")) install.packages("data.table")

# install devtools library and REvoBC
if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools")
library("devtools")
install_github("Nowak-Lab/REvoBC", ref = "master")

# load REvoBC library
library("REvoBC")

Debug

Please feel free to contact us if you have problems running our tool at l.patruno@campus.unimib.it.
